com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface createOrderFromMasterOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface createOrderFromMasterOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document createOrderFromMasterOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The createOrderFromMasterOrder API creates an order from a Master Order.

    • Method Detail

      • createOrderFromMasterOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document createOrderFromMasterOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                         throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                java.rmi.RemoteException

        The createOrderFromMasterOrder API creates an order from a Master Order. The order created will have normal payment processing, scheduling, releasing, shipments, etc. The configurable template, Default From Master Order, will be used to determine what attributes from the Master Order to copy to the newly created order.

        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: See createOrder API for details.

        Events Raised: See createOrder API for additional events.

        Raised during the transaction CREATE_ORD_FRM_MSTR
        ON_SUCCESS:
        This event is raised upon successful execution of createOrderFromMasterOrder. The output contains the details of the order created.
        Data published - CREATE_ORD_FRM_MSTR.ON_SUCCESS
        Template Support: Yes

        Audits: Configurable

        Pre-conditions:

        • Order must exist.

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Additional Information:

        This API will create an order with the document type configured by the CREATE_ORD_FRM_MSTR transaction's derived document type. Attributes configured in the Default From Master Order template will be used to create the order. Only lines that meet the below criteria will be added to the order.
        • Entire quantity of a line must be in a pickable status of the CREATE_ORD_FRM_MSTR transaction.
        • Line's FirstIterationSeqNo and LastIterationSeqNo must surround the Master Order's NextIterationSeqNo.
        • Line is not prevented from a hold.
        • Line is not prevented from transaction dependencies.
        Overriding Order Details
        Elements on the new order can be overridden based on the input XML to the API. See the input xml for more details on which elements can be specifically overridden. These elements will completely override the elements that would be copied from the Master Order. For example, if the Master Order has two payment methods (Credit Card and Customer Account) and the input contains a different payment method (Check), only the payment method passed in the input (Check) will appear on the new order.
        NOTE: If the createOrderFromMasterOrder API is used within a monitor event service, please ensure that it used in a different transaction boundary than the order monitor itself. Using the same transaction boundary may prevent future iterations.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the output of the created order. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Yantra exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
